message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.SI 

The paper discusses security policies for domains on the Internet, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also utilizes existing trust infrastructures such as TLS and DNSSEC, which are related to network security (cs.NI). The proposed framework involves managing and publishing domain-level security policies, which can be considered as software engineering (cs.SE). The framework also utilizes the existing DNS infrastructure, which is related to distributed computing (cs.DC). Finally, the paper discusses the overheads of deploying the proposed framework, which can be considered as system and information theory (cs.SI).
